definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: An Egyptian slave given to Abraham by the Pharaoh of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 埃及的法老给了亚伯拉罕一个仆婢。

sentences.english: His father, Piye, had returned the true pharaonic customs to Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲，皮耶，将真正的法老传统带回了埃及。

sentences.english: The figure is from a statue of the king standing in a boat throwing a harpoon.
sentences.chinese: 这件雕像雕刻的是古埃及法老站在一艘船上投掷鱼叉。

sentences.english: After the people of Israel left Egypt, Pharaoh regretted and pursued the people of Israel with his army.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人出埃及后，法老后悔而带领军兵去追杀。

sentences.english: The pharaohs of ancient Egypt wore blue for protection against evil.
sentences.chinese: 古埃及法老穿蓝色以辟邪。

sentences.english: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
sentences.chinese: 法老和他一切臣仆都以这事为妙。

sentences.english: Then Moses and Aaron were driven out of Pharaoh's presence.
sentences.chinese: 于是把他们从法老面前撵出去。

sentences.english: Pharaoh's daughter will eventually discover him.
sentences.chinese: 法老的女人最终后发现他。

sentences.english: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
sentences.chinese: 法老把他的百姓领入歧途，他未将他们引入正路。

sentences.english: Then Joseph said to his brothers, "Come close to me."
sentences.chinese: 这风声传到法老的宫里，说，约瑟的弟兄们来了。

sentences.english: Joseph was 30 years old when the Pharaoh made him second in Charge.
sentences.chinese: 法老在约瑟30岁时立他作埃及的宰相。

sentences.english: Pharaoh was pleased with Joseph. He put him in charge of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 法老王很喜欢约瑟，就派他统管埃及。

sentences.english: Found by the pharaoh's daughter, he was reared in the Egyptian court.
sentences.chinese: 他被法老王的女儿发现，在埃及宫廷长大。

sentences.english: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
sentences.chinese: 我的佳偶，我将你比法老车上套的骏马。

sentences.english: Because he has said, The Nile is mine, and I made it.
sentences.chinese: 因为法老曾说，尼罗河是我的，是我所造的。

sentences.english: They then leave, sealing the sanctuary ahead of the pharaoh's daily visit.
sentences.chinese: 他们拜别的时候，封印在法老每天的到临前再次封闭。

definition: Thebes, place name in ancient Egypt/Thebes, ancient Greek city state
Tutankhamen, king of ancient Egypt 1333-1323 BC
Tutankhamen, king of ancient Egypt 1333-1323 BC
Herod the Great (73 BC - 4 BC), Roman-appointed king of Judea (37-4 BC)
Ahab (9th c. BC), King of Israel, son of Omri and husband of Jezebel, prominent figure in 1 Kings 16-22
